message.content:
cs.CR, cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.SY, cs.NI 

This paper discusses a solution to the vulnerability of security-critical authorities, which falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR). The proposed architecture involves a communication tree, which is a common concept in distributed computing (cs.DC) and distributed systems (cs.DS). The paper also mentions scalability, which is a key concern in both distributed computing and networking (cs.SY). Finally, the implementation of logging, timestamping, and public randomness functions suggests a focus on network security (cs.NI).
